name: Experiment 1: Immunohistochemistry (IHC)
description: Stains tissues to detect specific proteins for localization studies.

name: Experiment 2: Histology
description: Prepares and stains tissues for microscopic examination of structure.

name: Experiment 3: In vitro tissue culture
description: Grows tissues outside the body to study cell behavior.

name: Experiment 4: RNA Sequencing of Tissues
description: Analyzes gene expression by sequencing RNA from tissues.

name: Experiment 5: Tissue Microarray (TMA)
description: Embeds multiple tissue samples for high-throughput analysis.

name: Experiment 6: Cryosectioning
description: Freezes tissues and cuts thin sections for imaging and analysis.

name: Experiment 7: Ex vivo perfusion
description: Maintains tissues with continuous flow to study function outside the body.

name: Experiment 8: Tissue Decellularization
description: Removes cells, leaving the scaffold for tissue engineering.

name: Experiment 9: Organotypic Tissue Slices
description: Cultures tissue slices to study complex interactions.

name: Experiment 10: Biomechanical testing of tissues
description: Measures mechanical properties like stiffness of tissues.
